alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 8:58PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN ORLEANS, SOUTHEASTERN ST. TAMMANY PARISHES IN SOUTHEASTERN LOUISIANA AND SOUTHERN HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CST... At 858 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Catherine, or 11 miles southeast of Slidell, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Diamondhead, Pearlington, Stennis Space Center, Shoreline Park, and Kiln. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 271 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
